author: jimmygchen
content: Thanks <@159152274659082240> , looks like they're now syncing

author: bridge-bot
content:
<asn_d6> @inphi and everyone else implementing 4844. Here are some crypto updates for EIP4844. Just a different way of ordering the roots of unity around the code. The aim is to bring the cryptography closer to the danksharding, and to make the commitments between 4844 and danksharding compatible.

Please see https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/3006 .

author: bridge-bot
content: <asn_d6> Let us know if you have any questions.

author: bridge-bot
content: <inphi> thanks for the heads-up asn. will take a look in a bit.

author: abdel.stark
content:
<@973581740734050334> are you working on the blob spammer tool ?
If yes I am curious to know what stack you will use to implement it. Specifically on how you plan to send transactions since the new format is only available in the forks of Geth and Prysm for the devnet.
Maybe you could implement the spammer as a wrapper of <@159152274659082240> blob-utils tool (in Go).
<@456226577798135808> I created an issue in `ethers-rs` for the support of EIP-4844 transaction format, I saw you posted a comment in another issue about that. I added some open questions in the issue, like what lib to use for SSZ encoding: https://github.com/gakonst/ethers-rs/issues/1742

author: abdel.stark
content: <@486501030046203915> did you start looking at the economic incentives side of things regarding EIP-4844 ? I would be curious to hear your thoughts on the new fee market for blobs.

author: abdel.stark
content:
For example <@301186049323958275> suggested during the breakout room #3 that we could tune the constants of EIP-1559 model to have it less agressive in terms of adjustment for the blob market base fee. I think it would be an interesting approach, and that your 1559 simulators could be tweaked to evaluate different scenarios
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1KgKZnb5P07rdLBb_nRCaXhzG_4PBoZXtFQNzKO2mrvc/

author: timbeiko
content: Ansgar has been looking at this, and after a bunch of discussions, this is the latest PR:  https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/5707

author: barnabemonnot
content: I have not looked at it in a while, but checked the PR that <@552133098075193354> just sent, will also check with <@415548822983278593> if more analysis is helpful!

author: bridge-bot
content: <asn_d6> > <asn_d6>  yep let me know!! (re @inphi: thanks for the heads-up asn. will take a look in a bit.)

author: bridge-bot
content: <asn_d6> i also updated the EIP PR that brings the EIP cryptography up to date: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/5649#issuecomment-1258635375

author: bridge-bot
content: <asn_d6> not much to do there from our side, it's mostly on the side of the EIP editors to accept/merge it

author: gakonst
content: Responded in the issue, thx. We could easily write a tx spamming tool then. I personally also like the idea of using https://github.com/tsenart/vegeta + https://github.com/shazow/ethspam/. I tried doing a variant of that for raw eth transactions with https://github.com/gakonst/eth-vegeta/ + https://github.com/gakonst/spammers. So we'd generate a bunch of json rpc requests and then submit them en masse with vegeta, which is a well optimized load testing tool.

author: booklearner
content:
ðŸ‘‹ hey, not actively working on it yet (been knocked out by covid for the last month) but yeah it's something I have in my backlog to look at -- I have `blob-utils` as a reference so yeah that was the idea! I'd probably just use Go (if that's what you meant by stack?). I'm going to be running devnet nodes along with some observability tools I'll make available (basic monitoring + I want to run some continuous profilers so we can get granular perf results from blob txs)
https://github.com/mdehoog/eip4844-testnet <- this to join the existing devnet
happy to chat further, just lmk

author: booklearner
content: I'll look through these tools -- thanks for sharing!
